alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 9:08PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Arthur, southern Grant and central Garden Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 807 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge to 9 miles north of Arthur. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arthur, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Haythorn Lake, Rackett, Dogtown Flats, Swede Lake, Sand Puddin Lake, Deer Lake, Britton Lake, Kincaid Lake, Wild Horse Flats, Mumper, Jensen Lake, Bourquim Hill, Dominick Lake, Jerry Lake, Velma, Adams Flats, Pratt Lake and Spring Valley Lake. This includes Highway 61 between mile markers 122 and 123, and between mile markers 126 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for the Panhandle of and west central Nebraska.
